intro: Rumex bucephalophorus f. canariensis, commonly known as the Canary sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its broad, arrow-shaped leaves with a reddish underside. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typically borne on short stalks. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
